document_data.name: Alemander III
document_data.mainbody: King '''Alemander III''' of [[House Tethyr]] was a king of the [[Lions' Dynasty]] of [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Relationships: Alemander was the nephew of King [[Errilam I]]. He was married to a woman named [[Lhayronna]], and he had twin sons, [[Jaszur]] and [[Olosar]], but it is not known if Lhayronna was their mother. Each son would later reign after him. Alemander also had a younger sister named [[Zakhina Theone|Zakhina]].
document_data.Activities:
Alemander III commissioned the construction of the [[Minaret Palace]] in [[Zazesspur]], which served as a summer palace for the royal family.

Alemander also commissioned the writing of a work of history, the ''[[Chronicla Tethyria]]'', which described the history of the kingdom. Because of his hatred of [[elf|elves]], however, the work covered up any mention of elf-[[human]] relations.
document_data.History:
Alemander III was born in [[1262 DR]]. In [[1274 DR]], he became a father, well before his coming of age.

Alemander took the throne in [[1277 DR]],

King Alemander died in [[1288 DR]] and was succeeded by his son Jaszur.
